result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell G Donati was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. No obj to early term of prob after 18 mo if def completes all cond of prob w/ no violations, ATR's or new charges to level of probable cause.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 if def completes all cond of prob w/ no violations, ATR's or new charges to level of probable cause.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.
